name: W3C Digital Verification Community Group
tagline: Increasing trust on the Web, one spec at a time
body:
### The W3C Digital Verification Community Group

The mission of the [W3C Digital Verification Community Group](https://www.w3.org/community/digital-verification/) is to study, design, implement, and deploy systems that increase trust on the Web. These systems include, but are not limited to signature systems, data normalization algorithms, and computational proof systems.

### Specification

The group is currently incubating, implementing, and deploying the following specifications:

* [Linked Data Signatures](https://w3c-dvcg.github.io/ld-signatures/) - Describes a mechanism for ensuring the authenticity and integrity of linked data documents using digital signatures.
* [2016 RSA Signature Suite](https://w3c-dvcg.github.io/lds-rsa2016/) - Signature Suite for RSA 2016.
* [2016 Koblitz Elliptic Curve Suite](https://w3c-dvcg.github.io/lds-koblitz2016/) - Signature Suite for the Koblitz Elliptic Curve 2016.
* [2016 Redaction Signature Suite](https://w3c-dvcg.github.io/lds-redaction2016/) - Signature Suite created in 2016 for performing Redacted signatures.
* [2016 Pseudonymous Signature Suite](https://w3c-dvcg.github.io/lds-pseudonymous2016/) - Signature Suite for Pseudonymous 2016 signatures.
